title: Brexit begins to bite for British expats buying insurance
text:
A no-deal Brexit will mean 1.3 million British expats living in Europe face an insurance nightmare that will leave them unable to change their policies and struggling to renew.

The danger is that if Britain has a hard Brexit then the country will instantly drop out of European Union (EU) financial regulation, which currently allows expats to buy insurance from British firms.

No deal means expats will be unable to buy any new ones from British insurance firms unless they have an EU branch, according to guidelines from European financial regulator Eiopa.
